mdRecord.dcterms:title: Texas State Capitol Building, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Myers, Elijah E. (American architect, 1832-1909) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The capitol has 360,000 square feet (33,000 square meters) of floor space, more than any other state capitol building, and is on 2.25 acres (.9 hectares) of land. The building has nearly four hundred rooms and more than nine hundred windows. The capitol houses the legislature and governor's office. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
legislative buildings
domes (architectural elements)
lanterns (roof appendages)
pediments
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 112 E 11th Street, Austin, Travis, Texas, United States
